tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE geospatial_data_table (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  location_name TEXT,
  latitude FLOAT,
  longitude FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE locations (
  location_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  latitude DECIMAL(9,6) NOT NULL,
  longitude DECIMAL(9,6) NOT NULL,
  address VARCHAR(255)
)

CREATE TABLE geospatial_data (
  data_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  location_id INT,
  data_type VARCHAR(50),
  data_value JSON
)

CREATE TABLE spatial_analysis (
  analysis_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  data_id INT,
  analysis_type VARCHAR(50),
  result JSON
)

CREATE TABLE geospatial_data(
  id BIGSERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  location_name VARCHAR(100),
  latitude DECIMAL(9, 6),
  longitude DECIMAL(9, 6),
  created_at TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE user_locations(
  user_id BIGINT,
  location_id BIGINT,
  check_in_timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(id),
  FOREIGN KEY (location_id) REFERENCES geospatial_data(id)
)

CREATE TABLE spatial_analysis(
  analysis_id BIGSERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  analysis_name VARCHAR(100),
  result TEXT,
  created_at TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE user(
  id BIGSERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  username VARCHAR(50) UNIQUE,
  email VARCHAR(100)
)

CREATE TABLE locations (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  name VARCHAR(50),
  latitude DECIMAL(9,6),
  longitude DECIMAL(9,6)
)

CREATE TABLE users (
  user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  username VARCHAR(50),
  email VARCHAR(50),
  location_id INT,
  FOREIGN KEY (location_id) REFERENCES locations(id)
)

CREATE TABLE routes (
  route_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  route_name VARCHAR(50),
  distance DECIMAL(10,2),
  start_location_id INT,
  end_location_id INT,
  FOREIGN KEY (start_location_id) REFERENCES locations(id),
  FOREIGN KEY (end_location_id) REFERENCES locations(id)
)

CREATE TABLE analysis_results (
  result_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  route_id INT,
  analysis_date DATE,
  result_text TEXT,
  FOREIGN KEY (route_id) REFERENCES routes(route_id)
)

CREATE TABLE geofences (
  geofence_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  name VARCHAR(50),
  area DECIMAL(12,2),
  center_location_id INT,
  FOREIGN KEY (center_location_id) REFERENCES locations(id)
)
